title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman conceded a center-ice goal during Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Speculation arose that black boards affected visibility, but Swayman remarked his colorblindness made it moot.
The U.S. team may limit Swayman's play, with two other goaltenders available for upcoming matches.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum could return from his Achilles injury, potentially impacting Celtics' playoff prospects.
Kevin Durant, recovering from a similar past injury, predicts All-Star level performance from Tatum upon return.
Carmelo Anthony views Tatum's return as a strategic advantage for the Celtics in the playoffs.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to target new free agents this offseason.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential free agent targets for the Patriots.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips also considered suitable signings for the Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN has become MLB's new streaming home, offering MLB.TV as an add-on to its ESPN Unlimited service.
Subscribers to ESPN Unlimited can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season, while non-subscribers pay $149.99.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers are automatically renewed, with options to stream via the MLB or ESPN app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics in G League, sparking speculation of a potential return this season.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. confirmed Tatum looked strong in practice, but no timetable for his return is set.
Celtics president Brad Stevens emphasized Tatum's return will depend on him being "110 percent" ready post-Achilles injury.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in 2026, per a WalletHub study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, the highest in the U.S.
Vermont and Maryland follow as the second and third most educated states, respectively.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction until February 21, featuring Massachusetts connections.
The card, initially found in Sweet Caporal Cigarettes, belonged to Morton Bernstein's family, who had ties to Taunton, MA.
Ken Goldin of Netflix's "King of Collectibles" estimates the card's value could reach over $6 million, despite being ungraded.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics on Saturday.
Swayman's Olympic debut follows his strong performance in the 2025 IIHF World Championship, where he helped Team USA win.
Swayman joins Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy on the ice; McAvoy played in Thursday's game against Latvia.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: The New England Aquarium identified a dead North Atlantic right whale as a 3-year-old female found off Virginia.
The whale, daughter of right whale #3293 "Porcia," is the second right whale fatality documented in two weeks.
Scientists link fishing gear entanglements and vessel strikes as main causes of serious injuries and deaths for the species.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A seventh child has died from flu-related causes in Massachusetts this season, per the state Department of Public Health.
A total of 260 flu-related deaths have occurred this season in Massachusetts, including seven children and 253 adults.
Health officials urge flu vaccinations as cases decline but continue circulating, affecting hospitals and pediatric units in Massachusetts.
